name: dispiritedly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows you do not feel much hope about a particular situation or problem: She turned and walked dispiritedly towards the door. "It's hopeless," he replied dispiritedly.
More examplesFewer examplesShe returned to her room and rather dispiritedly began to pack her things up. A couple of homeless people trudged dispiritedly past.She took one last look in the mirror, sighing dispiritedly at the sight of her own reflection. He was slumped dispiritedly against the sofa cushions.
